tweets.text: UPDATE - After the appeal we put out last night to @EnvAgency @ClintonDevon @kiergroup & @NESouthWest there was no nest destruction today at the River Otter Restoration Project in Devon and the partners are reconsidering their plans - thank you . Top work @WiseBirding et al . https://t.co/A8KSk5gcuE

Breaking News . @EnvAgency have sanctioned the destruction of breeding birds tomorrow at the Lower Otter Restoration Project . This is #HS2 part 2 . PLEASE THINK AGAIN @ClintonDevon @kiergroup @NESouthWest Please follow @WiseBirding and RT https://t.co/I8Wv40YKqy

urls.title: The Chilterns AONB - News
urls.description: Buckinghamshire Council and the Chilterns Conservation Board have serious concerns about the impacts of HS2’s tunnelling operations on Buckinghamshire’s aquifer and chalk streams. These concerns relate to pollution resulting from tunnelling operations, increasing abstraction of water and impacts on the flow of significant chalk streams, such as the River Misbourne. A joint Position Statement has been issued with a series of questions regarding these concerns, and the Council and the Chilterns Conservation

tweets.text:
Here is a good statement reflecting our concerns with regard to HS2 Tunnelling and the impact on the chalk aquifer https://t.co/tUIdNMbtSW
It is with sadness we announce a very compliant @EnvAgency have approved the tunnelling without any public consultation.

tweets.text: @MarkMalbas @CanalRiverTrust @severnrivers @EnvAgencyMids @HeritageFundM_E @LIFEprogramme Beautiful pun! Might have to steal that one 😆 Booking will be via our website - hoping to start that later in the summer when all visitor experience elements have been completed and no COVID19 concerns🤞.

Via the NEW Diglis fish pass, twaite shad can now swim past #Worcester on their #SevernShadRun for the first time in nearly 180yrs! 🎉🐟🎉 
Please watch & share our video! #FollowTheShad #FishMigration @CanalRiverTrust @severnrivers @EnvAgencyMids @HeritageFundM_E @LIFEprogramme https://t.co/kzh7NFPljc

tweets.text:
Are you a student or recent graduate interested in a career that will help protect the environment?

We have a range of placements and #GraduateJobs available.

Find out more and apply by 3 May: https://t.co/GH5p9655IW
People have to fight not only polluting industries but now also the @EnvAgency and their own government @DefraGovUK to stop the rot. How on earth did that happen? https://t.co/oN4HCpp52u

Today we published “Doing its job?”, a report on the @EnvAgency and its role protecting English rivers, lakes and streams. The report shows Agency failing to protect rivers, with its hands tied by central Gov. The time to reverse river damage is now https://t.co/y71Uhx7jzp

@ChrisGPackham @EnvAgency @ClintonDevon @kiergroup @NESouthWest @WiseBirding Thanks for the RT Chris.The ‘ecologist’ only stepped forward when she saw me start to film. She’d stood back with no regard for the creatures & their homes that were being destroyed. It still distresses me to watch it back now.

We finally cleared the enormous rubbish pile from the River Douglas! 
Incredible teamwork @stormwater_jo @Mike_Forty @VitaminSNC @DouglasPilot @RibbleTrust @WiganCouncil @CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgencyNW 
Before and after photos https://t.co/Mo59VFOzlI

urls.title: Is the Environment Agency doing its job?
urls.description: Guy Linley-Adams, Solicitor to Salmon & Trout Conservation, shares the findings from their new report on the role of the Environment Agency & why greater investment is needed to make our rivers, lakes, and streams healthy by 2027.

#thursdaymorning without stink wind blowing away from me looking at wind direction I should be ok tell tomorrow, we shouldn’t have to plan our day by where the wind blows #StopTheStink @StinkStopthe @Cap_it_off @EnvAgency just close it down I’m not getting it but someone else is

tweets.text:
The coarse fish close season has started. This means it’s illegal to fish for coarse fish in rivers until 15th June inclusive.  

Don’t forget, there are plenty of still waters or canal coarse fisheries where you can fish. 

Learn more: https://t.co/u6IhTpkgUB https://t.co/ujbBmr7aUX

@Hillfortian @ChilternsAONB @BucksCouncil @EnvAgency @Feargal_Sharkey @AquiferChalk Just reading the bit about needing up to 10 million litres of water a day for the tunnel boring machines. I knew they needed a lot of water. I had no idea it was that much.

Thanks to our funders @HeritageFundUK @LIFEprogramme and all the partners and supporters who joined us online this morning to celebrate the completion of the Diglis Fish Pass! 
As @MikeMorris_SRT said- everyone who's be involved at any level should be very proud! #FollowTheShad https://t.co/JyOjpjSjI3
@SarahofScrubs @ChrisGPackham @EnvAgency @ClintonDevon @kiergroup @NESouthWest @WiseBirding This is why I hate #HS2 . Wanton destruction of our countryside and our wildlife that lives there.

@Anna_Dillon @ChilternsAONB @BucksCouncil @EnvAgency @Feargal_Sharkey @AquiferChalk Therefore NONE of the models they are relying on as evidence of safe tunnelling are sound. garbage in, garbage out. First rule of modeling. There's insufficient data to be confident they won't disrupt the entire system. 
And don't get me started on all the other knock on effects!

@DouglasPilot @Greenstreet @stormwater_jo @GroundworkCLM @River_Douglas_ @Mike_Forty @Bithells @WiganCouncil @Wingate_Wood @EnvAgencyNW @WigToday @VitaminSNC Wow! What a huge improvement - great effort by all! 👏
@WiseBirding @EnvAgency @ClintonDevon @NESouthWest @ChrisGPackham @Natures_Voice @DevonWildlife Nice one Chris,  well done.

Thanks go to @stormwater_jo for expertly managing the clean up. @Bithells 4 donating Skips. We filled 2! £ Donations @GroundworkCLM @RibbleTrust @EnvAgencyNW @WiganCouncil @CRTNorthWest @stormwater_jo and a lot of hard work from @River_Douglas_ our partners & the RAM Safety Crew!
